protocol.description:
This protocol allows a client to request exclusive mode for its window. When exclusive mode is enabled, the compositor will minimize all other toplevel windows on the same output. When exclusive mode is disabled or the window is closed, the compositor will restore the previously minimized windows.
This is useful for applications like AI assistants or system overlays that need to temporarily hide all other windows to provide a clean focused interface.

interface.name: zcosmic_exclusive_mode_manager_v1
interface.description: This interface allows clients to create exclusive mode controllers for their toplevel surfaces.

request.name: get_exclusive_mode

description.summary: get exclusive mode controller for a surface

request.description:
Create an exclusive mode controller for the given wl_surface. The surface must be the root surface of an xdg_toplevel.
Only one exclusive mode controller can be active per surface. Creating a second controller for the same surface is a protocol error.

interface.name: zcosmic_exclusive_mode_v1
interface.description: This interface allows clients to enable or disable exclusive mode for their window. When exclusive mode is enabled, all other toplevel windows on the same output are minimized. When disabled, they are restored.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy this exclusive mode controller. If exclusive mode was enabled, this implicitly disables it and restores minimized windows.

request.name: set_exclusive
request.description:
Enable or disable exclusive mode for this window.
When enabled (exclusive = 1): - All other toplevel windows on the same output are minimized - The compositor tracks which windows were minimized by this request - This window remains visible and gains focus
When disabled (exclusive = 0): - Windows that were minimized by this exclusive mode are restored - Windows minimized by user action remain minimized
The compositor will send an 'enabled' or 'disabled' event in response.

event.name: enabled
event.description: Sent when exclusive mode has been successfully enabled. The count indicates how many windows were minimized.

event.name: disabled
event.description: Sent when exclusive mode has been disabled, either by client request or because the window was closed/destroyed. The count indicates how many windows were restored.

event.name: failed
event.description: Sent when an exclusive mode request could not be fulfilled. This can happen if another window already has exclusive mode, or if the compositor policy prevents exclusive mode.
